item.title: Trump urges Israel's president to pardon Benjamin Netanyahu
item.description: President Herzog's office says he holds Trump "in the highest regard", but that anyone seeking a pardon has to submit a formal request.

item.title: Starmer says he 'never authorised' attacks on ministers after leadership row
item.description: Conservative leader Kemi Badenoch accused the prime minister of running a "toxic" Downing Street.

item.title: Danish man given suspended sentence for sharing nude film scenes on Reddit
item.description: Police said the man shared 347 clips of naked actors on the social media site, which were viewed 4.2 million times.

item.title: 'We want a Grand Slam, England want our scalp'
item.description: New Zealand boss Scott Robertson wants to turn "expectation to joy" as he and his All Blacks side zero in on a first Grand Slam tour since 2010.

item.title: 'Salary cap would be legally challenged by clubs'
item.description: A Premier League proposal to introduce a controversial salary cap "cannot be imposed unilaterally", says Professional Footballers' Association chief e...
